elements.name: panel1
elements.title: How can you approach the following situations so as to go one step further?

elements.name: question2
elements.title: When you have lost a customer in a conversation.
elements.correctAnswer: Approach the customer actively: I kind of feel that I haven't been able to convince you entirely so far. Can I provide you with more information to help with the decision?

elements.name: question3
elements.title: When the customer doesnâ€™t close the sale.
elements.correctAnswer: Possible approaches: I suspect that there is a specific point worrying you that I haven't dealt with - what is it? Or: Please excuse me. It seems I've got so carried away by my enthusiasm for this quote that I've missed something out in the presentation. What makes you say that? Or: What needs to be added for you to be able to say "yes"?

elements.name: question4
elements.title: When the other party does not agree.
elements.correctAnswer: Try to put yourself in their shoes. What would be needed for her to be able to agree in principle?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: When the interlocutor is not interested in the matter.
elements.correctAnswer: Address the disinterest actively: what else would essentially have to be added for you to take an interest in this?
